iaik.pdf.parameters

Class CMSSignatureParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • iaik.pdf.parameters.SignatureParameters
      • iaik.pdf.parameters.CMSSignatureParameters
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CadesBESParameters

    public abstract class CMSSignatureParameters
extends SignatureParameters
    Abstract parameter superclass used to create CMS signatures with classes CadesSignature or CadesSignatureStream.
    See Also:
    CadesSignature, CadesSignatureStream

      Constructor and Description
      CMSSignatureParameters()

      void addContentTimestampProps(java.lang.String tsaUrl, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Add all details required to create a content timestamp and add it as signed attribute to the signature.
      void setContentTimestampProperties(java.lang.String tsaUrl, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Set details of timestamp authority, in order to add a content timestamp as signed attribute to signature.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CMSSignatureParameters

        public CMSSignatureParameters()

    • Method Detail

      • addContentTimestampProps

        public void addContentTimestampProps(java.lang.String tsaUrl,
                                     java.lang.String username,
                                     java.lang.String password)
        Add all details required to create a content timestamp and add it as signed attribute to the signature. To create multiple timestamps, add timestamp properties for each timestamp that shall be added.
        Parameters:
        tsaUrl - URL of the timestamp authority
        username - username for authorization
        password - password for authorization

      • setContentTimestampProperties

        public void setContentTimestampProperties(java.lang.String tsaUrl,
                                          java.lang.String username,
                                          java.lang.String password)
        Set details of timestamp authority, in order to add a content timestamp as signed attribute to signature.
        Parameters:
        tsaUrl - URL of the timestamp authority
        username - username for authorization
        password - password for authorization
